intro: Galanthus ketzkhovelii, commonly known as the Ketzkhovel narcissus, is a rare and striking member of the Amaryllidaceae family. Native to the mountainous regions of eastern Turkey, this plant is characterized by its distinctive white flowers with a yellow corona. It typically blooms in early spring, showcasing its elegant, cup-shaped petals. The plant prefers well-drained, sandy soils and thrives in cool, temperate climates. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
